2024-2025 Shepherd University Catalog

Communication and New Media, B.A. or B.S.

Print-Friendly Page (opens a new window)
Facebook this Page (opens a new window)
Tweet this Page (opens a new window)

Shepherd University offers a program in communication leading to the bachelor of arts or the bachelor of science degree. The Department of Mass Communications at Shepherd University fosters student learning through personal empowerment and achievement using technological skills, intellectual challenges, and cultural insights to contribute to students’ understanding of culture, community, and self.

The purpose of the communication program includes the following:

1. To expose the student to the theory and practice of communication and digital media.

2. To provide students an educational foundation in broadcast and digital media technologies including video, audio, animation, web design, game design, social media, strategic communication, and media studies.

3. To prepare students for continuing studies and employment at all levels of media (from production to management, mass to micromedia) through a rigorous program of cultural studies and computer-mediated communication.

Students take core classes, elective practicum and capstone sequences, and choose one of four concentrations: 1) digital filmmaking, 2) communication studies, 3) journalism, or 4) strategic communication. The Department of Mass Communications also offers minors in Communication Studies  and Journalism .

 

Curriculum for a Bachelor of Arts, Major in Communication and New Media

Required courses, 39 + 12 Language Hours:

In addition to the 39 required COMM credits, students pursuing the Bachelor of Arts must satisfy the B.A. Foreign Language Requirement Â . Students take core classes, elective practicum and capstone sequences, and choose one of four concentrations: 1) digital filmmaking, 2) communication studies, 3) journalism, or 4) strategic communication.

Required core courses, 18 Hours:

Students must complete lower-level core courses before taking 400-level courses.Â  However, students are encouraged to begin taking their concentration courses concurrently.

  • COMM 203 - Communication and New Media (3 cr)

  •  

  • COMM 302 - Narrative Screenwriting (3 cr)
  • OR  COMM 335 - Writing Across Platforms (3cr)

  •  

  • COMM 304 - History of Film (3 cr)
  • OR  COMM 306 - History of Advertising (3cr)

  •  

  • COMM 352 - Computer-Mediated Communication (3 cr)

  •  

  • Select 6 credits from the following:

  • COMM 402 - Seminar in Communications (3cr)
  • COMM 403 - Media Studies (3 cr) ***
  • COMM 404 - Gender and Film (3cr) ***
  • COMM 406 - Advertising and Imagery (3 cr) ***

Select one concentration, 12 Hours:

Digital filmmaking concentration, 12 Hours:

  •  

  • Select 9 credits from the following:

  • COMM 329 - Sound Design (3 cr)
  • COMM 350 - Digital Filmmaking (3 cr)
  • COMM 333 - Music Video (3 cr)
  • COMM 343 - Graphic Novel (3 cr)
  • COMM 345 - Animation and Communication (3 cr)
  • COMM 346 - Motion Graphics (3 cr)
  • COMM 347 - Special Effects (3cr)
  • COMM 354 - Experimental Video (3 cr)
  • COMM 356 - Elements of Film (3cr)
  • COMM 360 - TV Production (3 cr)
  • One course from strategic communication concentration (3)

  •  

  • Required:

  • COMM 420 - Advanced Production (3 cr)

Communication Studies concentration, 12 Hours:

Â 

  • Select any 9 credits from the 300-level courses in the digital filmmaking or strategic communication concentrations (9)

  •  

  • Required:

  • COMM 420 - Advanced Production (3 cr)
  • OR  COMM 447 - Advanced Internet Media (3 cr)
  • OR  COMM 470 - Strategic Campaigns (3cr)

Journalism concentration, 12 Hours:

  • Required Courses:

  • JOUR 204 - Introduction to Journalism (3cr)
  • JOUR 300 - Visual Reporting (3 cr)
  • JOUR 444 - Practicum in The Picket (3 cr)


  • Elective Courses, select 3cr from the following:

  • JOUR 144 - Practicum in The Picket (3cr)
  • COMM 322 - Social Media (3cr)
  • COMM 329 - Sound Design (3 cr)
  • COMM 360 - TV Production (3 cr)
  • ENGL 473 - Creative Writing: Nonfiction (3 cr)
  • PHOT 281 - Digital Photography (3cr)
  • PHOT 290 - History of Photography (3 cr)
  • PHOT 389 - Image and Meaning (3 cr)
  • PSCI 306 - Introduction to Political Communication (3cr)
  • RECR 227 - Sport Broadcasting (3 cr)

Strategic Communication concentration, 12 Hours:

  • Select 9 credits from the following:

  • COMM 321 - Public Relations Principles (3cr)
  • COMM 322 - Social Media (3cr)
  • COMM 435 - Media and Audience Analytics (3cr)
  • One course from the Digital Filmmaking concentration (3cr)
     

  • Required:

     

  • COMM 470 - Strategic Campaigns (3cr)
  • OR  COMM 447 - Advanced Internet Media (3 cr)

Required practicum** (one course from the following), 3 Hours:

  • COMM 348 - News Practicum (3 cr)
  • COMM 349 - New Media Practicum (3 cr)
  • COMM 326 - Radio Practicum (3cr)

Required capstone courses, 6 Hours:

  • COMM 450 - Internship in Communication (3cr)
  • OR  COMM 392 - Cooperative Education in Communications (1-6 cr)
  • OR  COMM 402 - Seminar in Communications (3cr) ****


  •  

  • COMM 451 - Senior Capstone Preparation (1cr)
  • COMM 461 - Senior Capstone Project (2cr)

Four-Year Course Progression

Curriculum for a Bachelor of Science, Major in Communication and New Media

Required courses, 45 Hours:

Students take core classes, elective practicum and capstone sequences, and choose one of four concentrations:Â  1) digital filmmaking, 2) communication studies, 3) journalism, or 4) strategic communication.

Required core courses, 21 Hours:

Students must complete lower-level core courses before taking 400-level courses.Â  However, students are encouraged to begin taking their concentration courses concurrently.

  • COMM 203 - Communication and New Media (3 cr)

  •  

  • COMM 302 - Narrative Screenwriting (3 cr)
  • OR  COMM 335 - Writing Across Platforms (3cr)

  •  

  • COMM 304 - History of Film (3 cr)
  • OR  COMM 306 - History of Advertising (3cr)

  •  

  • COMM 352 - Computer-Mediated Communication (3 cr)

  •  

  • Select 9 credits from the following:

  • COMM 402 - Seminar in Communications (3cr)
  • COMM 403 - Media Studies (3 cr) ***
  • COMM 404 - Gender and Film (3cr) ***
  • COMM 406 - Advertising and Imagery (3 cr) ***

Select one concentration, 15 Hours:

Digital Filmmaking Concentration, 15 Hours:

  •  

  • Select 12 credits from the following:

  • COMM 329 - Sound Design (3 cr)
  • COMM 350 - Digital Filmmaking (3 cr)
  • COMM 333 - Music Video (3 cr)
  • COMM 343 - Graphic Novel (3 cr)
  • COMM 345 - Animation and Communication (3 cr)
  • COMM 346 - Motion Graphics (3 cr)
  • COMM 347 - Special Effects (3cr)
  • COMM 354 - Experimental Video (3 cr)
  • COMM 356 - Elements of Film (3cr)
  • COMM 360 - TV Production (3 cr)
  • One course from the strategic communication concentration (3)

  •  

  • Required:

  • COMM 420 - Advanced Production (3 cr)

Communication Studies concentration, 15 Hours:

  • Â Select any 12 credits from the 300-level courses in the digital filmmaking or strategic communication concentrations (12)

Â 

  • Required:

  • COMM 420 - Advanced Production (3 cr)
  • OR  COMM 447 - Advanced Internet Media (3 cr)
  • OR  COMM 470 - Strategic Campaigns (3cr)

Journalism concentration, 15 Hours:

  • Required courses:

  • JOUR 204 - Introduction to Journalism (3cr)
  • JOUR 300 - Visual Reporting (3 cr)
  • JOUR 444 - Practicum in The Picket (3 cr)


  • Elective Courses, select 6cr from the following:

  • JOUR 144 - Practicum in The Picket (3cr)
  • COMM 322 - Social Media (3cr)
  • COMM 329 - Sound Design (3 cr)
  • COMM 360 - TV Production (3 cr)
  • ENGL 473 - Creative Writing: Nonfiction (3 cr)
  • PHOT 281 - Digital Photography (3cr)
  • PHOT 290 - History of Photography (3 cr)
  • PHOT 389 - Image and Meaning (3 cr)
  • PSCI 306 - Introduction to Political Communication (3cr)
  • RECR 227 - Sport Broadcasting (3 cr)

Strategic Communication concentration, 15 Hours:

  • COMM 321 - Public Relations Principles (3cr)
  • COMM 322 - Social Media (3cr)
  • COMM 435 - Media and Audience Analytics (3cr)
  • One course from the Digital Filmmaking concentration (3cr)


  • Select one:

  • COMM 470 - Strategic Campaigns (3cr)
  • OR  COMM 447 - Advanced Internet Media (3 cr)

Required practicum ** (one course from the following), 3 Hours:

  • COMM 348 - News Practicum (3 cr)
  • COMM 349 - New Media Practicum (3 cr)
  • COMM 326 - Radio Practicum (3cr)

Required capstone courses, 6 Hours:

  • COMM 450 - Internship in Communication (3cr)
  • OR  COMM 392 - Cooperative Education in Communications (1-6 cr)
  • OR  COMM 402 - Seminar in Communications (3cr) ****


  •  

  • COMM 451 - Senior Capstone Preparation (1cr)
  • COMM 461 - Senior Capstone Project (2cr)

Note(s):

**Students may take practicum courses three times for a total of nine credit hours. The first three hours count toward a major and any additional hours are counted as general electives.

***COMM 403 - Media Studies ,Â  COMM 404 - Gender and Film , and COMM 406 - Advertising and Imagery Â are also electives in the women’s studies minor.

****COMM 399 Special Topics and COMM 402 - Seminar in Communications Â are courses in new technologies, course content, or faculty research and publication. These courses may be taken more than one time if the topics or instructors are different. These classes may be used as substitutions for courses in the regular catalog; please obtain permission to substitute a course from the department chair prior to registration.
